channel.title: BIKEPACKING.com
channel.description: Bikepacking Routes, Stories, Gear, and Inspiration

item.title: New 2018 Ortlieb Seat-Pack M and Handlebar-Pack S
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
At this year's Sea Otter Classic, Ortlieb teased a second wave of bikepacking bags. We had a chance to test the Seat-Pack M and Handlebar-Pack S in advance, here’s the scoop…

The post New 2018 Ortlieb Seat-Pack M and Handlebar-Pack S appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: New Ibis Ripley 3rd Gen looks pretty tasty.
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Ibis' Ripley has always looked like a pretty good full-suspension bikepacking rig. Released today, the 3rd generation model adds 2.6″ tire clearance and slightly more aggressive geometry…

The post New Ibis Ripley 3rd Gen looks pretty tasty. appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Great Divide Route Landscape Sculptures Illustrate Voting Power
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
As part of an independent bikepacking/research project, Myles Peña creates landscape castings of sections of The Great Divide Mountain Bike Route to visually illustrate the voting power of Wyoming…

The post Great Divide Route Landscape Sculptures Illustrate Voting Power appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Rout3: Bikepacking Routes Challenge
item.dc:creator: Editor Team
item.description:
Win an awesome bikepacking setup! Here at Bikepacking.com, we're thrilled to announce one brand new 2017 Surly Krampus and three fantastic Revelate Designs bags are up for grabs, as well as a slew of other great prizes. All you have to do is plan and ride an amazing three-day bikepacking route within the next three months… Read on for more info on this year’s route building competition.

The post Rout3: Bikepacking Routes Challenge appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Tramontana
item.dc:creator: Montanus
item.description:
Tramontana is the latest short film by Montanus, a bikepacking project out of Abruzzo, Italy. The film is one-half expedition and one-half introspective dreamscape. Feel the cold darkness, hear the crackle of the fire, and then learn how they made the film as well as the DIY portable woodstove that takes center stage.

The post Tramontana appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: New Mexico Off-Road Runner
item.dc:creator: Cass Gilbert
item.description:
The New Mexico Off-Road Runner leaves the adobe-studded state capital of Santa Fe via the city’s car-free Rail Trail. Initially headed east, it begins its 500-mile journey along a lattice of primitive dirt roads that wend their way through peaceful piñon and juniper-speckled Rowe Mesa, a taste of classic high desert riding. Hopscotching from the […]

The post New Mexico Off-Road Runner appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Good To-Go Bibimbap and Breakfast!
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
One of our favorite trail food companies recently released two new meals — Spicy Korean Bibimbap and Mexican Quinoa. They also added two breakfast items to their menu. We took several out on the trail and feasted over the weekend. Here's the verdict.

The post Good To-Go Bibimbap and Breakfast! appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: The Kenai 250, Alaska
item.dc:creator: Guest Routes
item.description:
Given how wild and remote most of Alaska is, there are few regions within the state that offer the ability to link up great singletrack into one continuous route. The Kenai Peninsula, located in south central Alaska, has some of the highest density of rideable singletrack alongside many of Alaska’s most incredible scenery offering visitors […]

The post The Kenai 250, Alaska appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: The 2017 Swift Campout is on!
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Swift Industries announces the 3rd annual Swift Campout on June 24th and 25th, 2017. Learn how to plan your Solstice overnighter and be a part of this great event...

The post The 2017 Swift Campout is on! appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: New Fyxation Sparta All Road Carbon Fork has Bottle Mounts.
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Just what a lot of folks have been asking for.... an adventure-friendly carbon gravel/all-road fork with bottle mounts.

The post New Fyxation Sparta All Road Carbon Fork has Bottle Mounts. appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: A Mind-bending Baja Divide, by Gabriel Amadeus
item.dc:creator: Gabriel Amadeus
item.description:
With little preparation, Gabriel Amadeus spent a month on the Baja Divide as part of the 100+ rider grand depart. Judging by this mesmerizing set of photos, he found far more than he expected along the way…

The post A Mind-bending Baja Divide, by Gabriel Amadeus appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Fly Through Trails with new Ordinance Survey Aerial 3D
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
As every British bikepacker already knows, the Ordinance Survey is second to none when it comes to mapping lands in exhaustive, obsessive detail. Having already added a digital lineup to compliment its ever-popular paper Landranger series, the government-run national mapping agency has just launched Aerial 3D as part of their OS Maps application...

The post Fly Through Trails with new Ordinance Survey Aerial 3D appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Viral Skeptic Review + The Pinion P1.12 Gearbox
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
With a belt drive, Pinion Gearbox, 27.5+ tires, and an oddly colored titanium frame, the Viral Skeptic might come off as something of a concept bike when it’s clean and shiney. But after a couple months getting it dirty, the sum of its parts equals a rather slick future-proof rig. Read our comprehensive review as well as a detailed look at the Pinion P1.12.

The post Viral Skeptic Review + The Pinion P1.12 Gearbox appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: When The Trail Goes Cold
item.dc:creator: Guest
item.description:
RJ Sauer's epic account of the 1,000-mile Iditarod Trail Invitational race from Knik to Nome, Alaska. A must-experience piece complete with maps, hallucinations, introspection, and exquisite detail of a monumental journey.

The post When The Trail Goes Cold appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Comes with Baggage
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Blackburn's 'Comes with Baggage' is now free! If you haven't yet seen this 2015 gem, it's a must-watch 18 minute documentary on the history of bike travel... from boneshakers to bikepacking.

The post Comes with Baggage appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Remembering Mike Hall
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
We’re incredibly sad to announce that Mike Hall, a hero, inspiration and legend in the bikepacking community passed early this morning in Australia. Here are few words by several people who knew and loved Mike ....

The post Remembering Mike Hall appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Pisgah Project: Think Local, Win this Bike.
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Or just look at some pretty pictures of a really sweet bike. Nevermind that it could be yours, and it just happens to be built through a collaboration by several local companies to support some amazing trails...

The post Pisgah Project: Think Local, Win this Bike. appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Wanderlust Bikepacking Bags: The Cuba Shakedown
item.dc:creator: Colt Fetters
item.description:
Wanderlust is an Austin, TX based company offering a complete range of bikepacking bags. Colt and Hannah tested full kits from Wanderlust for two weeks on Cuba’s rugged dirt roads… each packed to the brim with stale bread, sun tan lotion, and Cuban cigars. See how they fared in this kit overview/review…

The post Wanderlust Bikepacking Bags: The Cuba Shakedown appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Into The Island of Ice: Bikepacking Baffin Island
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
An 'illustrated' video documenting a bikepacking trip over the Akshayuk Pass, a new 100 mile route across Baffin Island's Auyuittuq National Park...

The post Into The Island of Ice: Bikepacking Baffin Island appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Old Ghost Road, New Zealand
item.dc:creator: Guest Routes
item.description:
The best long single track ride in New Zealand, the Old Ghost Road starts deep in dense, mossy and gnarled native bush and slowly climbs up to a misty high alpine ridge line, passing dozens of waterfalls along the way. Up high, there’s tight single track, exposure on trail that’s been painstakingly blasted into hard […]

The post Old Ghost Road, New Zealand appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: California Basketpackin’
item.dc:creator: Cass Gilbert
item.description:
Here at bikepacking.com, we like to feel we're an open-minded collective of riders and explorers. Ever fascinated by different modes of carrying cargo on his bike - depending on the length and style of the trip - Cass reports back on his experiences 'basketpacking' in Southern California, along with a full a breakdown of his gear list.

The post California Basketpackin’ appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: In Search of the Best Bike Bell: The Bikeway Shootout.
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Whether used to warn 'slow-walkers' or just say hello in a universal language, bike bells rule. In our search for the best bike bell for the job, we narrowed our choices down to five contenders. Here’s our take on each. And read on to see which one really rang our bell. Ding ding.

The post In Search of the Best Bike Bell: The Bikeway Shootout. appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Trans Ecuador Mountain Bike Route: Dirt Road Version
item.dc:creator: Cass Gilbert
item.description:
TEMBR Dirt is the mellower hermano to the unremittingly challenging TEMBR Singletrack. It strives to encourage bicycle tourists to escape the hectic traffic of the Panamerican Highway and delve deep into Ecuador’s backcountry, without missing some of the country’s classic sights. Staying high in the Andes for much of the time, it’s a showcase for […]

The post Trans Ecuador Mountain Bike Route: Dirt Road Version appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Lost Coast North
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Over a thousand incredible moments captured in the latest film from Mike Curiak, documenting an epic return bikerafting expedition to Alaska's Lost Coast. Spoiler alert: mind-bending glacial fragments, insane mountain backdrops, a stink-whale... it's all here.

The post Lost Coast North appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: New Santa Cruz Chameleon: Bikepacking-ready trail stud?
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
The all new Santa Cruz Chameleon is capable of shifting from a trail rig to a bikepacking mule using an elegant swappable dropout system — and 29er or 27.5+ hoops. It’s not too shabby to look at either. What do you think?

The post New Santa Cruz Chameleon: Bikepacking-ready trail stud? appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Salsa Warbird Review: An Underbiking truce.
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Back in the fall Logan and Joe borrowed a pair of Salsa Warbirds to ride the Green Mountain Gravel Growler. Here are their thoughts on the bike after a week of riding gravel, dirt tracks, plenty of singletrack... and Vermont’s infamous Class 4 roads.

The post Salsa Warbird Review: An Underbiking truce. appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Revelate Mag-Tank: Fit for Vikings
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Inspired by Vikings — one source says — the new Revelate Mag-Tank forgoes a zipper and provides bag access via a smartly contoured top flap held in place by a brilliant magnetic buckle. See how it performed over 1000+ miles of rough and tumble terrain. Also, find a comparison with the venerable Gas Tank.

The post Revelate Mag-Tank: Fit for Vikings appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Baja Divide: A Film by Tales on Tyres
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
A stunning new film documenting one couple's experience while bikepacking the Baja Divide. Plus the route in their words alongside a beautiful collection of photos...

The post Baja Divide: A Film by Tales on Tyres appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Trans-Cuba: La Ruta Mala
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
On January 1st, Virginia, Joe and I set out to cycle across Cuba using mainly off-pavement tracks. Our journey began in the eastern coastal city of Santiago de Cuba and carried us over three mountain ranges starting with the Sierra Maestra. Over the course of three weeks we cycled through seemingly infinite farming communities, two […]

The post Trans-Cuba: La Ruta Mala appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Alchemy Kratos Ti Gravel Bike Launched at NAHBS
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Denver, CO based Alchemy Bicycle Co just launched several new bikes at NAHBS including the Kratos, dubbed by Alchemy as their 'titanium gravel/adventure bike'.

The post Alchemy Kratos Ti Gravel Bike Launched at NAHBS appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Clikstand Stove Review: the Sound of Silence.
item.dc:creator: Cass Gilbert
item.description:
The Clikstand is a lightweight, minimal stove system designed around the classic Trangia alcohol burner. Diminutive enough to pack in a framebag, it's also perfectly proportioned for a gourmet cooking campout. Read on to discover why we like it so much...

The post Clikstand Stove Review: the Sound of Silence. appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Rocky Mountain Blizzard -30 Review: Back to The Future
item.dc:creator: Miles Arbour
item.description:
In an industry that can often be oversaturated with new upgrades, ultra-light carbon everything, and electronic components; there are still those that believe in rock solid bikes with reliable parts. The Rocky Mountain Blizzard -30 is a sturdy fat bike that offers plenty of packing space and mixes just the right amount of modern ingenuity with time-tested features.

The post Rocky Mountain Blizzard -30 Review: Back to The Future appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: The Palmetto Trail: Southern Ditch Divide!
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Established in 1994, the Palmetto Trail is slated to be a 500 mile trans-state trail that crosses South Carolina from its northwest corner in Walhalla, to the coast at Awendaw. There are currently about 350 miles of trail that have been ‘completed’. All accounted for, the Palmetto Trail is made up of 26 yet to […]

The post The Palmetto Trail: Southern Ditch Divide! appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Across Cuba… the bad way.
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
After just a single day into our Cuba traverse, we unanimously agreed that the route should be named ‘La Ruta Mala’, or ‘the bad way’. That’s quite a contradiction considering that our bikepacking trip across The Pearl of The Antilles would turn out to be a beautiful and fantastic adventure. But, then again, it took less than 24 hours to realize that Cuba is brimming with anomaly.

The post Across Cuba… the bad way. appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: The LA Observer, California.
item.dc:creator: Cass Gilbert
item.description:
Rideable straight out of the city, the LA Observer connects Mount Wilson Observatory to Mount Lukens; the latter’s radio towers mark the highest point in LA city. En route, it reveals far-reaching views across this vast metropolis, a sprawling mass of humanity that stops only at the shores of the Pacific itself. In terms of […]

The post The LA Observer, California. appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Rider & Rig: Joe Cruz’s Seven Treeline SL
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
In the first of a new series, Rider & Rig, we take a look at Joe Cruz's Seven Treeline SL titanium fat bike. Find out more about the bike, the journeys he takes it on, and how he packs it...

The post Rider & Rig: Joe Cruz’s Seven Treeline SL appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: 45NRTH Wolvhammer Boots: (re)designed with purpose
item.dc:creator: Miles Arbour
item.description:
The latest 45NRTH Wölvhammer boot was reworked to fill the gap between performance-oriented design and cozy comfort. So how’d they fare in the frigid and snowy environs of British Columbia?

The post 45NRTH Wolvhammer Boots: (re)designed with purpose appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: 2017 Surly Ogre Review: ETs, Molokos, 27.5+, and a braze-on fiesta…
item.dc:creator: Cass Gilbert
item.description:
Following the Troll's recent revamp, it was only a matter of time before Surly's 29er all-rounder, the Ogre, underwent a similar transformation. Read on to discover details of its 2017 incarnation and thoughts on its frameset, set up with 27.5+ wheels. Also included are musings on the relative merits of different Plus sizes, depending on the style of your backcountry explorations.

The post 2017 Surly Ogre Review: ETs, Molokos, 27.5+, and a braze-on fiesta… appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Announcing the Pipedream A.L.I.C.E. Adventure Bike
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
Announcing the release of the new Pipedream A.L.I.C.E., the latest dropbar adventure/gravel-grinder rig from Scotland…

The post Announcing the Pipedream A.L.I.C.E. Adventure Bike appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Cape Wrath by Fatbike and Packraft
item.dc:creator: Guest
item.description:
A short film about a journey to the most northwesterly point on the UK mainland — Cape Wrath. Lee Craigie and Andy Toop used fatbikes and packrafts to access the rugged terrain and rough seas. With stunning drone shots and a voiceover by Lee, the short film depicts an adventure with a twist.

The post Cape Wrath by Fatbike and Packraft appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Do’s and Don’ts on the Appalachian Beer Trail
item.dc:creator: Colt Fetters
item.description:
Lessons from a first time bikepacker on the Appalachian Beer Trail, a craft beer themed bike packing route in western North Carolina...

The post Do’s and Don’ts on the Appalachian Beer Trail appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Pogies: A funny looking necessity.
item.dc:creator: Miles Arbour
item.description:
You thought you got some puzzled looks while riding your fat bike? Try strapping some boxing glove sized sleeping bags to your bars. It’s easy to scoff at cycling pogies, they can first appear cumbersome and a bit overkill. But the truth is, they work. Miles had the chance to test out three of the best pogie options available from Revelate Designs, 45NRTH, and Dogwood Designs. Here are thoughts on each as well as a history of these curious mitts…

The post Pogies: A funny looking necessity. appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Lee Craigie’s inner journey along the Caledonia Way
item.dc:creator: Guest
item.description:
A short video that perfectly captures why riding a bike is a means to restorative escape. In this inspiring film Lee Craigie, co-founder of the Adventure Syndicate, explores her mind while bikepacking the beautiful Caledonia Way in Scotland... Plus more about that route.

The post Lee Craigie’s inner journey along the Caledonia Way appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Crankbrothers Stamp Pedals Review: Long-term Platform
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
There are three reasons we chose the new Crankbrothers Stamp pedals for our ~900 mile trip across Cuba: 1. Dave said he put 3,000 miles on his and they are still going strong; 2. They have a 5-year warranty; 3. They are thin, light, and come in two sizes — small and humongous.

The post Crankbrothers Stamp Pedals Review: Long-term Platform appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Chumba Stella Ti Review: Ultra XC or Solid Adventure?
item.dc:creator: Colt Fetters
item.description:
The CHUMBA Stella Ti is designed to feel equally at home ripping the local XC course as it does lightly loaded racing the Tour Divide. But does it hold up to fully loaded bikepacking? Colt Fetters took it on Cuba’s roughest tracks to find out…

The post Chumba Stella Ti Review: Ultra XC or Solid Adventure? appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Kona Wozo in Ireland: A Microadventure
item.dc:creator: Guest
item.description:
Who couldn't use bikes, beer and a break from life? Here's William O’Connor's words and a video about the perfect escape — one that involved an all-day ride through the Irish countryside, a micro pub crawl, camping, and a solid trail ride on some killer singletrack... all within 24 hours.

The post Kona Wozo in Ireland: A Microadventure appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Torino-Nice Rally: The Film
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
The newly released Torino-Nice Rally film follows rider Joachim Rosenlund over 700km of old military Cols and scenic historical trade routes leading from the western Italian Alps to the coast of southern France.

The post Torino-Nice Rally: The Film appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: The Hunt 1000 Australian Alps Trail
item.dc:creator: Guest Routes
item.description:
Developed for the inaugural Hunt Bikes Snowy Mountains 1000 event in November 2016, the objective of the route is to link two of Australia’s major cities, Canberra and Melbourne, and traverse some of Australia’s most beautiful high country in a tough but achievable seven days. The route links some amazing campsites and historic alpine huts, […]

The post The Hunt 1000 Australian Alps Trail appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: MSR Trailshot Review: Hell or No Water
item.dc:creator: Logan Watts
item.description:
MSR recently released the Trailshot, a new type of water filter that employs a one-handed squeeze operation in a pocket-size and lightweight package. We took it on a month long tropical adventure through Cuba to see if it would meet the needs of two thirsty cyclists…

The post MSR Trailshot Review: Hell or No Water appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.

item.title: Warm & Dry Winter Bikepacking: A Packlist
item.dc:creator: Miles Arbour
item.description:
It doesn’t take long for one’s bikepacking addiction to start pushing you out the door further into the shoulder seasons. But when the dead of winter comes into play, this is a next-level habit. Winter bikepacking offers a whole new set of challenges. Miles shares how he tackled these demands through carefully planning the right gear.

The post Warm & Dry Winter Bikepacking: A Packlist appeared first on BIKEPACKING.com.
